un4-5nkWLdxtq0qonKK3FA.text: spontaneous selection of restaurant for dinner and it was a good choice.we went for the spicy cheesy kimchi fried rice and spicy stir fried squid.it was really spicy and thank goodness for the cheesy fried rice because the mozarella cheese helped put out the fire in the belly. the fried rice was served in a small pot and it was fun scrapping the charred rice on the bottom if you are one who enjoys savoring "guo ba."simply press the call button on the table for service and the servers show up promptly.great place to go to for small portions and a decent korean meal.

nanIBUwa8hvkTD249RrKYg.text: Pork stew ($16.80 for an individual portion++) - 2 starsSpiciness Level 1Glass noodlesToo little meat and too much fat and bone. There weren't many pieces to begin with. Worse still was the broth. Yes, we got it not very spicy but that shouldn't be an excuse for it tasting like flavorless pork fat. The one good thing was the purple rice that came with it since I'm used to Korean places here only serving white rice.Spicy beef ($15.80++) - 2.5 starsBetter but again very little meat.$38.40 after the service charge and GST. Not worth it. They charge for water and we didn't get any. Two miserable "banchan." Portions were small and we weren't full. The menu was also very limited - you won't see things like japchae or more homestyle dishes here. They pretty much just have some stews, hotplates, fried rice and egg. Very disappointed. -1 star for these!

photos.caption: Photo of Masizzim Singapore - Singapore, Singapore. "Banchan" - 2 sorry-looking dishes

oej_Kekvt1Eogj2ZFtQgUw.text: Recently another new Korean restaurant has opened in the shopping mall. It was known for its stew which is available in pork, beef and chicken. Remember to press the button on the table when one is ready to order.Water was served in a bottle.Banchan (appetizers)The Banchan available were lettuce with salad cream, pickled radish, and kimchi.Pork Rib Stew ($16 individual/$29 double)The stew was available in soy flavour and 4 different levels of spicy flavour. One can choose udon or glass noodle for the stew.I had selected level 1 of spicy flavour with glass noodle. The glass noodle was transparent flat noodle which was similar to kueh teow but with a chewy texture. The stew was served on a stove to keep warm. Quite rich and thick which one felt will nice to have plain rice to go with. The pork rib was fork tender but a bit too boney.Rice ball - Tuna ($8)Rice balls with tuna, Korean white rice, seaweeds crumbs, and crushed chilli padi.I topup $6 to upgrade the plain rice in the pork rib stew to rice ball.Step 1 : Put on gloves.Step 2 : Mix well.Step 3 : Mould into riceballs and enjoy.Quite an interesting and enjoyable experience. It tasted not bad too.Overall the food was not bad and served quite fast. Maybe it was because the place was not crowded and almost closing time.

photos.caption: Photo of Masizzim Singapore - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Masizzim Singapore - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Masizzim Singapore - Singapore, Singapore. Rice ball - Tuna

sjgShgKOpQkzew2Ad7ZlVw.text: Was craving for Korean and always appreciate a good stew place. Had the pork ribs and got kimchi fried rice. Liked the kimchi fried rice however thought the pot on the stove made it unstable - not the most convenient way to eat. I would put it in a hot stone pot instead - Korean style The stew was okay, a tad bit too sweet for me but it was still good. The pork was done nicely too Their spicy level is on point, got it at level three ( out of 4) Saw a rice cake delivery come in and they are using the  which is one of the bigger brands in korea. Only had one rice cake but it was done nicely too. If they had radish in the stew it would have been cherry on top Portions for one are just right though too huge for my small stomach. Great casual Korean restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Masizzim Singapore - Singapore, Singapore. Side dish and Yuzu drink
Photo of Masizzim Singapore - Singapore, Singapore. Counter
Photo of Masizzim Singapore - Singapore, Singapore. Interior

VZN_xzlpUER4EYaKbnL_5g.text: This korean restaurant exceeded my expectation. Though they do not have a very elaborated menu but it's substantial.Firstly, you MUST order their signature stew. We went for the pork stew with Level 1 spiciness. It's a good introduction. You may opt for other meat of your choice (i.e beef, chicken) and of course higher level of spiciness if you can take it and and and... you can top up extra noodle, rice cake etc...  sounds fun? Me on the other hand opted to take the rice ball instead of the normal rice with a surcharge of SGD6. The anchovy, seaweed and rice mixture were given to you to mass yourself ! It was fascinating to use the glove and shape those warm rice and fragrant anchovy into cute balls for serving =)Next, we also ordered a squid and leek pancake. It was crispy on the inside and soft in the inside. Super yummy.Will definitely be back to try other dishes on the menu

photos.caption: Photo of Masizzim Singapore - Singapore, Singapore. Anchovy rice ball
Photo of Masizzim Singapore - Singapore, Singapore. Signature pork stew, level 1 spiciness
Photo of Masizzim Singapore - Singapore, Singapore. Squid and leek pancake

CFjyg_gvxrA4FWpgtxmVmQ.text: The beef rib stew was just so so. Kind of sweet and portions were small. But I loved the tuna rice balls!

eZLzjG-w_kUNYMcr9M8wDQ.text: Ok we ordered the wrong stuff. I think it's better to stick to the stew than the beef rib soup which is sort of bland. The rice ball is tasty although if you are a dog owner you will recognize that familiar feeling of a plastic bag picking up something warm and soft lol Service. They forgot our kimchi. Actually that's my biggest bone to pick. I'm a big fan of Korean side dishes but there is none. That's disappointing. Price is fair. Expect to wait on line since it's popular at the moment. I'll try it again. This experience is sort of 2 star.

photos.caption: Photo of Masizzim Singapore - Singapore, Singapore. Dog poop
Photo of Masizzim Singapore - Singapore, Singapore. Beef rib soup. Skip this and go for the stew

I_Z0UZmMfsNdKmeo7gHv4g.text: Beef rib stew was pretty nice. Spicy chicken stew wasn't that great -  the chicken parts had a lot of bone. Rice balls were nice - seaweed was really fragrant and overall they had great texture and tasted pretty good. Overall filling, if a little pricy
